      • fileExtIs

        public static final boolean fileExtIs(java.io.File file,
                                      java.lang.String... extsList)
        Checks whether file extension matches one of the given extension.
        Parameters:
        file - File object containing file definition.
        extsList - String variadic params containing file list of file extension to compare (i.e.: "jpg", "html").
        Returns:
        True if file extension was matched (case insensitive), false otherwise.

        Parameters:

        file2 - File object 2
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        If file reading was successful returns String with file content, otherwise returns null. Method do not throws IOException.

        public static final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFileLines2ArraList(java.io.File file)
        Reads file lines into separate strings stored in ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        file - File object containing file definition.
        Returns:
        If file reading was successful returns ArrayList containing each lines from the file content, otherwise returns null. Method do not throws IOException.

                                java.lang.String content)
        Writes the given string into the the given file, previous file content will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        file - File object containing file definition.
        content - String containing content to be written.
        Returns:
        True if write was successful, otherwise returns false. Method do not throws IOException.

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.io.File file,
                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> content)
        Writes the given collection of strings into the the given file, previous file content will be overwritten. New line character will not be added after each string.
        Parameters:
        file - File object containing file definition.
        content - String collection containing content to be written.
        Returns:
        True if write was successful, otherwise returns false. Method do not throws IOException.

      • writeFile

                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> content)
        Writes the given collection of strings into the the given file, previous file content will be overwritten. New line character will not be added after each string.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Full path to the file.
        content - String collection containing content to be written.
        Returns:
        True if write was successful, otherwise returns false. Method do not throws IOException.
